Introduction

This folder contains sample programs that demonstrate how to make the various types of acquisitions supported by an AlazarTech ATS330 12-bit 50 MS/sec PCI digitizer board. The sample programs are part of the AlazarTech SDK, and are documented in the “AlazarTech SDK Programmer’s Guide”.

System requirements

Microsoft Visual C# 2008 is required to build the C# sample programs. Each sample includes a Visual C# 2008 solution file.

 

The AlazarTech ATS330 drivers version 5.7.7 or later are required to run the sample programs. They can be downloaded from our web site.

http://www.alazartech.com/support/downloads.htm

 

Many sample programs require a trigger input signal. Connect a 1Vpp, 1 KHz sine from a function generator to the CH A connector of the digitizer board before running these programs. If a suitable trigger signal is not supplied, an acquisition timeout interval will expire before the board receives the number of trigger events required to make the acquisition and, as a result, the acquisition will fail with a timeout error.

Getting started

Please do the following:

1.      Read the “ATS330 User Guide”. It provides an overview of the digitizer board’s hardware features, as well as its specifications.

2.      Read the “AlazarTech SDK Programmer’s Guide”. It describes how to program the digitizer hardware to make an acquisition, and to transfer sample data into application buffers.

3.      Use the SDK sample programs. They demonstrate how to make most types of acquisitions, and provide a starting point for creating new applications.

Single-port acquisitions

A single-port acquisition allows a board to acquire to on-board memory and, after the acquisition is complete, transfer sample data from on-board memory to application buffers.

 

Single-port acquisitions should be used when:

·        A board does not have optional dual-port memory.

·        The application can tolerate missing trigger events while it transfers data from on-board memory, and re-arms a board for another acquisition.

·        The average data acquisition data rate that is greater than the maximum PCI bus transfer rate.

 

Note that the maximum PCI bus transfer rate is up to 128 MB/s, but may depend by motherboard model and BIOS version, and that all devices connected to the same bus share this bandwidth.

Single-port samples

The samples in the “SinglePort” directory demonstrate how to make single-port acquisitions. Most programmers should begin with the “SinglePort\AR” sample.

 

Directory

Description

SinglePort\AR

This sample acquires records to on-board memory, and calls AlazarRead to transfer entire records from on-board memory to an application buffer. It demonstrates a basic single-port acquisition in C# environments.

SinglePort\AR_Volts

Based on “SinglePort\AR”, this sample adds code to write sample values in volts to a text file. It demonstrates how convert sample values in a buffer returned by AlazarRead into volts.

Dual-port AutoDMA acquisitions

A dual-port AutoDMA acquisition allows a board to acquire to on-board memory while, at the same time, transferring sample data from on-board memory to application buffers. The ATS330 does not support dual-port memory, so cannot use AutoDMA acquisitions.

Utility samples

The following sample programs demonstrate how to get information about a board.

Directory

Description

..\AlazarSysInfo

This sample calls a number of status and information API functions to display detailed information about digitizer boards. This information includes: sample size in bits, memory size in samples per channel, serial number, and latest calibration date. It demonstrates how to obtain a board handle, use the status and information API functions, and control the LED on a board’s PCI/PCIe mounting bracket.

..\AlazarApiNet

This sample builds AlazarApiNet.dll from AlazarApi.cs

Modifying a sample program

The AcqToDisk.cpp file in the sample sub-directory contains the code to configure a board, make an acquisition, transfer sample data to application buffers, and optionally save sample data to file.

 

Acquisition parameters should be modified to suite the application. All of the lines containing such parameters are labeled with “TODO” comments. Search for these lines in the source files, and modify them as required.

Building a sample program

·        Open the solution file in the sample directory.

·        Select the “Build | Configuration Manager” to display the “Configuration Manager” dialog and select the desired configuration and platform.

·        Select the “Build | Build Solution” command to build the sample program.

 

If a build succeeds, it created an executable file in the following directories:

Debug

bin\Debug

Release

bin\Release

For more information

The “AlazarTech SDK Programmer’s Guide”, included with this SDK, provides for more information about the functions used in these sample programs.

 

The latest documentation and drivers for your digitizer board can be downloaded from our web site.

http://www.alazartech.com/support/downloads.htm
